The Annotated Civilisation:  III. Works of Painting

July 9, 2020

Painters with 10 or more works featured:

  • Leonardo da Vinci
  • Albrecht Dürer
  • Michelangelo
  • Raphael
  • Rembreandt
  • Johannes Vermeer
  • Jacques-Louis David

Painters with 4–9 works featured:

  • Giotto
  • Jan van Eyck
  • Masaccio
  • Piero della Francesca
  • Andrea Mantegna
  • Sandro Botticelli
  • Lucas Cranach der Ältere
  • Hans Holbein der Jüngere
  • Frans Hals
  • Willem van de Velde de Jonge
  • William Hogarth
  • Jean-Baptiste-Siméon Chardin
  • Maurice Quentin de la Tour
  • Jean Huber
  • Joseph Wright of Derby
  • George Catlin

ANON.  (1C BC) [1]
  Frescoes in the Villa dei Misteri, Pompei

CIMABUE  (Italian, c. 1240–1302) [3]
  San Francesco d’Assisi
  Santa Trinita Maestà

GIOTTO  (Italian, c. 1267–1337) [3,4]
  Frescoes in the Cappella degli Scrovegni (Arena Chapel), Padova: Legend of St. Francis, Life of the Vrigin, and Life of the Chrrst, including Lamentation (The Mourning of Christ)

AMBROGIO LORENZETTI  (Italian, c. 1290–1348) [3]
  The Allegory of Good and Bad Government, frescoes in the Palazzo Pubblico, Siena

ANDREA DI BONAIUTO DA FIRENZE  (Italian, act. 1343–1377) [4]
  The Church Militant and the Church Triumphant, fresco in the Cappellone degli Spagnoli (Spanish Chapel) of the Santa Maria Novella, Firenze

HUBERT VAN EYCK  (Flemish, c. 1385/90–1426) [4]
  [With Jan van Eyck] Ghent Altarpiece, or Het Lam Gods (The Adoration of the Mystic Lamb)

JAN VAN EYCK  (Flemish, c. 1390–1441) [4]
  Portrait of Margaret van Eyck
  Portrait of Cardinal Niccolò Albergati
  Portrait of Giovanni di Nicolao Arnolfini and his Wife
  Portrait of Giovanni di Nicolao Arnolfini
  Portrait of a Man in a Red Turban (Self Portrait?)
  Portrait of a Man with Carnation
  [With Hubert van Eyck] Ghent Altarpiece, or Het Lam Gods (The Adoration of the Mystic Lamb)

SASSETTA  (Italian, c. 1392–1450/1) [3]
  Pala di Sansepolcro (Sansepolcro Altarpiece)

MASACCIO  (Italian, 1401–1428) [4]
  Frescoes in the Cappella Brancacci of the Basilica di Santa Maria del Carmine, Firenze: St. Peter Healing the Sick with His Shadow, The Distribution of Alms and Death of Ananias, Raising of the Son of Theophilus and St. Peter Enthroned, and The Tribute Money

JUSTUS VAN GENT (JOOS VAN WASSENHOVE)  (Flemish, c. 1410–1480) [4]
  Portrait of Federico da Montefeltro with His Son Guidobaldo (disputed)

APOLLONIO DI GIOVANNI  (Italian, c. 1414–1465) [5]
  Assassination and Funeral of Julius Caesar

PIERO DELLA FRANCESCA  (Italian, c. 1415–1492) [4]
  Portrait of Federico da Montefeltro
  Flagellation of Christ
  St. Sigismund and Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta
  Brera Madonna
  The Ideal City of Urbino (disputed)

DOMENICO DI MICHELINO  (Italian, 1417–1491) [3]
  La Divina Commedia di Dante, fresco in the Cattedrale di Santa Maria del Fiore, Firenze

LUCIANO LAURANA  (Italian, c. 1420–1479) [4]
  The Ideal City of Urbino (disputed)

FRA CARNEVALE  (Italian, c. 1420/5–1484) [4]
  The Ideal City of Baltimore

BENOZZO GOZZOLI  (Italian, c. 1421–1497) [5]
  Abduction of Helen

ANTONELLO DA MESSINA  (Italian, c. 1430–1479) [4]
  St. Jerome in His Study

GIOVANNI BELLINI  (Italian, c. 1430–1516) [4]
  Agony in the Garden

ANDREA MANTEGNA  (Italian, 1431–1506) [4,5]
  Frescoes in the Camera degli Sposi, or the Camera picta, of the Palazzo Ducale, Mantova: the north wall (Court Scene)—a family portrait of the Gonzaga, the west wall (Meeting Scene), and the oculus
  Triumphs of Caesar

BACCIO BALDINI  (Italian, c. 1436–1487) [4]
  Mercury in The Planets (engraving)

MELOZZO DA FORLÌ  (Italian, 1438–1494) [4,5]
  Sixtus IV Appointing Platina as Prefect of the Vatican Library
  The Ideal City of Urbino (disputed)

FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI  (Italian, 1439–1501) [4]
  The Ideal City of Urbino (disputed)

SANDRO BOTTICELLI  (Italian, c. 1445–1510) [1,4]
  St. Augustine in His Study
  Primavera
  Nascita di Venere (The Birth of Venus)
  Madonna della Melagrana (Madonna of the Pomegranate)

DOMENICO GHIRLANDAIO  (Italian, c. 1448–1494) [4]
  Storie di san Francesco d’Assisi (Life of St. Francis), frescoes in the Cappella Sassetti of the Basilica di Santa Trinita, Firenze: Confirmation of the Franciscan Rule

PEDRO BERRUGUETE  (Spanish, c. 1450–1504) [4]
  Portrait of Federico da Montefeltro with His Son Guidobaldo (disputed)

LEONARDO DA VINCI  (Italian, c. 1452–1519) [4,5,8]
  Uomo vitruviano, or Le proporzioni del corpo umano secondo Vitruvio
  Portrait of a Man in Red Chalk
  Head of a Girl
  A Horse in Profile, and from the Front
  A Scheme for a Canal to Bypass the Arno
  Head of St. James
  Recto: Studies of geometry, clouds, plants, engineering, etc. Verso: Studies of Geometry
  Paris Manuscripts B & A
  Seated Old Man and Studies of Water
  Studies of Water Passing Obstacles and Falling
  An Outcrop of Stratified Rock
  A Storm Over a Valley
  A Copse of Trees
  Sprigs of Oak and Dyer’s Greenweed
  A Branch of Blackberry
  A Star-of-Bethlehem and Other Plants
  The Bones and Muscles of a Bird’s Wing
  A Standing Male Nude
  Sketch of Internal Organs
  The Cardiovascular System and Principal Organs of a Woman
  Recto: The Bladder. Verso: The Lungs
  Recto: The Heart, Bronchi and Bronchial Vessels. Verso: A Sketch of the Heart and Great Vessels
  Studies of the Fetus in the Womb
  Recto: The Tongue, and the Production of the Voice
  Two Studies of the Upper Part of an Old Man and Two Studies of Arms
  The Muscles of the Arm, and the Veins of the Arm and Trunk
  Recto: A Man Tricked by Gypsies. Verso: An Inscription Describing Evil Men
  A Deluge

PINTURICCHIO  (Italian, 1454–1513) [4]
  Life of Aeneas Silvius Piccolomini (Pope Pius II), frescoes in the Piccolomini Library of the Duomo di Siena: The Embassy of Aeneas Silvius Piccolomini to James IV of Scotland and Aeneas Silvius Piccolomini Crowned Poet Laureate

VITTORE CARPACCIO  (Italian, c. 1465–1525/6) [4]
  St. Augustine in His Study

QUENTIN MATSYS  (Flemish, 1466–1530) [3,6]
  The Moneylender and His Wife
  Desiderius Erasmus

ALBRECHT DÜRER  (German, 1471–1528) [6]
  Portrait of Oswald Krell

  Self-portrait at Twenty-Six

  Head of a Walrus
  Preparatory study for The Rhinoceros
  The Port of Antwerp During Scheldetor
  Young Hare
  Great Piece of Turf
  Melencolia I (engraving)
  St. Jerome in His Study (engraving)
  Knight, Death and the Devil (engraving)
  Life of the Virgin (woodcuts): Birth of the Virgin, Annunciation, Adoration of the Shepherds (The Nativity of Christ), Flight into Egypt, and Rest on the Flight into Egypt
  Apocalypse (woodcuts): 4. The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse, 5. The Opening of the Fifth and Sixth Seals, and 12. Saint Michael Fighting the Dragon

LUCAS CRANACH DER ÄLTERE  (German, c. 1472–1553) [6]
  Luther as an Augustinian Friar, with Tonsure
  Luther as an Augustinian Friar, with Cap
  Portrait of Martin Luther, 1526
  Portrait of Katharina von Bora, 1526
  Portrait of Martin Luther as Junker Joerg
  Portraits of Hans Luther

MICHELANGELO  (Italian, 1475–1564) [5,13]
  Sistine Chapel ceiling: The Great Flood, The Fall and Expulsion from Paradise, The Separation of Land and Water, The Separation of Light from Darkness, Ezekiel Hears the Word of the Lord, Jeremiah Lamenting the Fall of Jerusalem, The Drunkenness of Noah, The Creation of Adam, and The Creation of the Sun, Moon, and Plants
  The Last Judgment, fresco on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel

GIORGIONE  (Italian, c. 1477/8–1510) [4]

  Portrait of Pope Julius II
  The Marriage of the Virgin
  Preparatory drawing for The Disputation of the Holy Sacrament

  Frescoes in the Logge di Raffaello (Vatican loggias) of the Palazzo Apostolico, Vaticano
  Raphael Cartoons: The Miraculous Draught of Fishes, Christ’s Charge to Peter
  Portrait of a Cardinal
